condition.description:
Heartburn is a painful burning feeling in your chest or throat. It happens when stomach acid backs up into your esophagus, the tube that carries food from your mouth to your stomach.

If you have heartburn more than twice a week, you may have GERD. But you can have GERD without having heartburn.

Pregnancy, certain foods, alcohol, and some medications can bring on heartburn. Treating heartburn is important because over time reflux can damage the esophagus.

Over-the-counter medicines may help. If the heartburn continues, you may need prescription medicines or surgery.

If you have other symptoms such as crushing chest pain, it could be a heart attack. Get help immediately.
condition.name: Heartburn

Having a dental or medical procedure? You may need to stop taking this before the big day. Ask your dentist or doctor.

basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer gives quick relief for headache, body pains, and upset tummies, but might be hard to swallow if you don't like the taste or fizz.
downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sodium levels
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Alka-Seltzer can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of sodium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Alka-Seltzer; a different antacid would be better for you.

If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Alka-Seltzer; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: May worsen heart or kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. Sodium can raise blood pressure and cause your body to hold on to water. If you have high blood pressure, heart failure, or kidney disease you should not take Alka-Seltzer.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. Sodium can raise blood pressure and cause your body to hold on to water. If you have high blood pressure, heart failure, or kidney disease you should not take Alka-Seltzer.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.
risk_factors: Children 18 years or younger recovering from viral infections

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach Bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer can cause serious stomach problems that include swelling, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Drinking 3 or more alcoholic drinks a day

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. This is rare. Stop taking Alka-Seltzer and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer may cause birth defects. Don't use Alka-Seltzer while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer may cause birth defects. Don't use Alka-Seltzer while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Dexilant with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Dexilant can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Dexilant.

basics.benefits_moa: Dexilant is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Dexilant is an effective medicine to treat heartburn and ulcers, but can be expensive.
downsides: Taking Dexilant in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Dexilant, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking Dexilant in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Dexilant, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Dexilant, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Dexilant can be taken daily.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can take a few days to start working.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Dexilant for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Dexilant for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Dexilant.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Dexilant for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Dexilant (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recenlty taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Dexilant or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recenlty taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Dexilant or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Dexilant (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Dexilant.  However, if you need to take Dexilant long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Dexilant, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Dexilant for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

clock.tip: Take on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Nexium is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Nexium gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. But this purple pill ain't cheap! The generic forms of alternative drugs work just as well, and are usually less expensive.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Nexium long-term.
Can be expensive. Other alternatives are usually cheaper than Nexium.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Nexium.

Can be expensive. Other alternatives are usually cheaper than Nexium.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Nexium.

upsides: Most people can take Nexium without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Nexium lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

carousel_items: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.

When using Omeprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Omeprazole.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Omeprazole.

clock.tip: Take on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Omeprazole gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. Choose the cheapest proton pump inhibitor because they all work equally well for heartburn.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

upsides: Most people can take Omeprazole without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Omeprazole lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

userStories.tip: Took Nexium for seven years, then found Omerprazole. Worked so well for two years that I cut the caplets in half two years ago. All's well so far. Have forgotten a few times but remember real quick, within two hours, discomfort.

The generics don't work as well as name-brand Prilosec, but it could just be placebo effect. I could get it much cheaper from the pharmacy for awhile (until my prescription plan stopped covering it) so ask your doctor if that's an option.

I was having horrible acid reflux and was diagnosed with Barrett's rings in my esophagus 9 years ago. Since I started taking this simple drug, the acid reflux is completely gone and the ring growth has been arrested.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Omeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Omeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Omeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Omeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Omeprazole.  However, if you need to take Omeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Omeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Omeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Chew or dissolve chewable tablets in mouth.
Shake Pepto Bismol liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
You can take a dose every 1/2 to 1 hour but don't take more than 8 doses in 24 hours.
Chewable tablets and liquid are not for children under 12 years.
Use until diarrhea stops but not more than 2 days. Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't go away after 2 days.
Don't take Pepto Bismol if you have an allergy to aspirin or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).

Don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who have or are getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye's Syndrome. Reye's syndrome causes brain and liver damage.
Can temporarily make your tongue and stools darker.
Stop taking Pepto Bismol and tell your doctor if you notice ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea and vomiting.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, gout or are taking medicines to thin your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Pepto Bismol is a stomach and intestine medicine with multiple effects. It relieves diarrhea by helping your intestines absorb water and electrolytes, and by lowering intestine inflammation and movement. It also has antibacterial and antacid effects.
basics.bottom_line: Pepto Bismol does it all, from upset stomach to crampy diarrhea.
downsides: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

upsides: Most people who take Pepto Bismol feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It's can also be used as part of treatment plan for H. Pylori., a stomach infection. H. Pylori is thought to be one of the reasons some people get ulcers.
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Rolaids.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Rolaids.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood calcium
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Rolaids can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Rolaids; a different antacid would be better for you.
risk_factors: Taking high doses of Vitamin D

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Rolaids can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Rolaids; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Rolaids contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones. basics.benefits_moa: Zegerid is a type of antacid called a proton pump inhibitor. It blocks the release of acid in your stomach, which treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Zegerid gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. Choose the cheapest proton pump inhibitor because they all work equally well for heartburn.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Zegerid.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Zegerid for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Zegerid (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Zegerid or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Zegerid (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Zegerid or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Zegerid (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Zegerid.  However, if you need to take Zegerid long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Zegerid, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Zegerid for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

risks_warnings.title: Weakens clopidogrel
risks_warnings.description: Zegerid can weaken the effects of the medication clopidogrel (Plavix).  Clopidogrel is used by people that have had a stroke or a coronary artery stent to prevent blood clots. Don't take Zegerid if you use clopidogrel.  If you feel you need Zegerid ask your doctor if any alternative medications for clopidogrel could work for you instead.

If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Prevacid or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Prevacid (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Prevacid.  However, if you need to take Prevacid long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Prevacid, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Prevacid for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.
